                                    January 5, 2011

       Introduced  by  Sen.  DIAZ  --  read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Transportation

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to the  use  of
         portable electronic devices while driving

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1.  Paragraph (b) of subdivision 2 of section  1225-d  of  the
    2  vehicle and traffic law, as added by chapter 403 of the laws of 2009, is
    3  amended to read as follows:
    4    (b)  "Using" shall mean holding a portable electronic device while (I)
    5  viewing, taking or transmitting images, (II)  playing  games,  or  (III)
    6  composing, sending, reading, viewing, accessing, browsing, transmitting,
    7  saving or retrieving e-mail, text messages, or other electronic data.
    8    S  2.  Subdivision 4 of section 1225-d of the vehicle and traffic law,
    9  as added by chapter 403 of the laws of  2009,  is  amended  to  read  as
   10  follows:
   11    4.  A  person  who holds a portable electronic device in a conspicuous
   12  manner while operating a motor vehicle is  presumed  to  be  using  such
   13  device. The presumption established by this subdivision is rebuttable by
   14  evidence  [showing]  TENDING TO SHOW that the operator was not using the
   15  device within the meaning of this section.
   16    S 3. Subdivision 6 of section 1225-d of the vehicle and  traffic  law,
   17  as  added  by  chapter  403  of  the laws of 2009, is amended to read as
   18  follows:
   19    6. A violation of this section shall be a traffic infraction and shall
   20  be punishable by a fine of not more  than  one  hundred  fifty  dollars.
   21  [Provided,  however,  that  a  summons  for operating a motor vehicle in
   22  violation of this section shall only be issued when there is  reasonable
   23  cause  to  believe  that  the  person  operating  such motor vehicle has
   24  committed a violation of the laws of this state other than  a  violation
   25  of this section.]
   26    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03315-01-1
